summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling its resolutions and statements on the Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC), particularly resolutions 1756 (2007) and 1794 (2007), 
Reaffirming its commitment to contribute to peace and stability in the DRC post-transition period through the United Nations Organization Mission in the DRC (MONUC),
Recalling the importance of elections, including local elections, for long-term peace, stability, national reconciliation, and establishment of the rule of law,
Encouraging international partners to support the electoral process,
Welcoming the Secretary-General's letters and report on MONUC,
Authorizes MONUC to provide assistance to the Congolese authorities in the organization, preparation, and conduct of local elections, in close coordination with international partners and the UN Country Team, as recommended by the Secretary-General;
Decides to remain actively seized of the matter.
